Title: Estimating the normal background rate of species extinction
Note for Student: This is a more detailed explanation of extinction rate measurements. It is added as the Science paper (Pimm et al 2014) may not be accessible in its published format.

Title: A global evaluation of forest interior area dynamics using tree cover data from 2000 to 2012
Accelerating extinction risk from climate change
Widespread amphibian extinctions from epidemic disease driven by global warming
Note for Student: This key paper analyses the interaction between climate change and disease in explaining the amphibian extinctions in central America (including the golden toad - a climate change icon).

Title: Species Invasions and the Limits to Restoration: Learning from the New Zealand Experience
Note for Student: A thought provoking article about how to respond to the multiple invasions in New Zealand. Also provides some interesting detail on the scale of the problem.

Note for Student: This online article is a response to the Riiters et al paper (A global evaluation of forest interior dynamics). It is written by the author of the text book Chapter on habitat destruction Bill Laurance. It puts the findings on forest loss nicely in context.
